title: I am now a Forumer, NOT a Summoner
body:
I will preface this by saying this is simply another rant about damage creep so you've heard it before, but I want to get it out.

I am now a "Forumer" visiting the boards every day instead of spending time playing the game I grew up on. I actually grew up on League of Legends. I started in Season 1 as a 14 year old and am now 23. This is the reason I am a "Forumer" instead of just a "Quitter." I love League of Legends and want it to come back to the game I remember. Riot did always say this is a strategy game first.

I am frustrated that this strategy game with mechanics mixed in has now turned into a faster-button-masher competition. There was a time in League of Legends where macro play was just as, if not more important, than micro play. That time has passed. I am forced to play assassin characters and try to snowball harder than whatever assassin/bursty character on the opposing team in the first 10 minutes of the game. If I fail to do this, I lose. Average game time in the rank I play (platinum) is 28 minutes ([https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/rankings/game-durations](https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/rankings/game-durations)). I can't even give an excuse to my loved ones "Hang on, I'm in a league match." The league match is over before they even get impatient.

I love outplays and quick big damage like the rest of everyone, but there needs to be a ceiling. No matter how fed a Zed/Talon/Akali/Insert other burst champion here gets, they should not be able to 1 shot a big boi tank like {{champion:31}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:33}} , etc. And on the same point, a champion like {{champion:86}} should not be able to 1 shot {{champion:84}} just because she picked up 3 kills early, is now the villain, and made 1 small misstep.

Damage needs nerfed across the board. I'm not a game developer and also question my own intelligence, so I don't know how this is done. I do know as a player though that I don't get home from work and want to sit down to play League of Legends. I don't spend time daydreaming about team compositions or strategies anymore. When I do think about League, it's thinking about the recent patch notes and trying to figure out what the next damage exploit I can use. (smite talon mid is back, btw)

I think I speak for maybe not everyone, but a large populous of the LoL community when I say "We do NOT want shorter games and more damage. We WANT Moscow 5 level of strategy back. We WANT that 45 minute baron call where {{champion:85}} and {{champion:32}}  both have ults up and are looking for a big wombo combo to finish the game. We WANT the Support roaming mid at a random time for a spicy 3 man gank for a slight advantage because dragon is spawning in 2 mins."

For now, I'll be a Forumer and Patch Notes reader waiting for the core of the game to come back to strategy.  If this never happen, thank you Riot for many years of a great game. I can't support this new game.

Yes, but different subsets of the community complained back then. 
Yeah, there's times when everyone would agree that something was beyond broken, but even back in the AP Yi days, a lot of people weren't complaining because they either saw ways to beat it or were happy to let it exist if it meant maintaining the integrity of the game.

Riot made the mistake of changing target demographics (either intentionally or oblivious to them) and they now have too wide a breadth of player preferences to cater to everyone in a single version of the game. 

Riot needed to address the problems that those players were complaining about in one game mode, while allowing the other to continue to develop as the other, roughly, half of the community wanted. Instead they forced change onto a iterative product, destroying the old one, and their support they'd garnered in the process.

I feel like it wouldn't be that big of a deal if the game had better match making. Winning feels given and losing feels hopeless. Theres always 1 person who just seems like they don't belong in the game or is similar skill of the other 9 players.

I think what you're actually seeing is someone who was just out snowballed. They probably are close in skill, actually Riot's matchmaking is some of the best this world has ever seen in any game, let alone this genre. The reason you _think_ it's a skill problem is because with just 1 kill most champions can snowball out of control with the damage the way it currently is.

I'm not saying skill gaps don't exist in some games, but I think the vast majority of the time it's damage snowballing and it's just so hard to stay alive right now. Try to think back at the last game you have twice or more of your kills in deaths, do you think whoever was beating you up was really that much greater of a player? Were they similar rank as you with a similar win rate?

Big thank you for sharing your opinion.

This game has changed too much and I don't think that those changes were positive. I think they were mostly negative.

The game isn't strategic anymore. That is all there is to it. 

Riot forgot that strategy was the most important factor of this game and they decided that flashy plays are more entertaining. Bullshit. I loved to watch how Froggen or Faker farm minions, because they were doing it perfectly. I enjoyed their exchanges in lane. Now I don't see those exchanges anymore, they are going on a full hp target and just killing it. What is strategic about that? 

In S5, we actually had to poke the enemy into 40% hp to even think about going in and killing them. That was all about usage of potions, good trading and wave control. You had to actually outsmart the enemy and hit your stun when the enemy was in the minion wave or near a wall, so that he cannot juke it. 

Now I don't have to use any strategies. I am just doing A LOT of dmg and they die.
Exactly my point.

Since when is this "damage creep" thing plaguing LoL? Because to me it feels exactly the same as two or three years ago. Maybe slightly worse, but barely.
Yet I only see people complaining now… Weird.
Maybe can't tell the difference because I've always mained ADC. I'm far too used to being one-shotted and 4-man dived.
It's because it's no longer just ADC getting 1 shot, it's everyone.

Ok, but… Since when? Due to what? I mean, I have been paying attention to patch notes pretty regularly, and haven't noticed any "Champions now do 15% more damage" change.

Changes that I did notice:

- Both enchanters and tanks with overall less utility and more damage (Thinking about {{champion:40}} {{champion:516}}, as examples).

- Key recent additions and/or reworks: {{champion:555}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:84}}. Two of them are Assasins, so they can easily one-shot and have easy escapes, and the other is... an hyper-mobile bruiser with a ranged multi-stun that also destroys everything and everyone besides the occasional counter-pick, if she's not fed. All of them super hard to peel, with loads of damage, two of which are specially good against shields, two of which can towerdive for breakfast, all of them having access to either defense-stats penetration, hybrid damage or both. So, they further decrease the efectiveness of both tanks and enchanters despite being assasins and divers. And the things that breaks them the most is not damage, but their insane mobility. Other one-shot recent additions: Evelynn, Assasin Kayn, Zoe and the latest, Neeko.

- Runes Reforged: This may be the biggest player in the damage creep problem. Even Resolve has more offensive than defensive options now. Then there's Dark Harvest, Electrocute, Conqueror…

- {{item:3095}} {{item:3147}} > {{item:3031}} {{item:3085}} // {{item:3135}} > {{item:3504}}

To me, all of this just looks like a burst meta. Anything with good CC or mobilty that has a lot of burst and outplay potential has become incredibly popular from what I can see. And I think the reason for that is recent new champs and reworks getting better at mobility and burst, as well as enchanters and crit adc's being in a really bad spot (due to reasons stated above) and tanks being better at damage and engages than at tanking or protecting.

I may be super wrong tho.

runes reforged lowered champions' overall base defenses, added even more damage to the game, accelerated snowball potential (seriously, did you know you can get 100 gold just for using an auto attack after an ability?)

while adding large amounts of additional burst to the game in recent updates.  Duskblade, stormrazor , dark harvest, etc

> to me it feels exactly the same as two or three years ago.

Well there's your reason. Maybe you weren't paying attention when you first started playing, but even I personally, made a post about how bad damage creep was getting back in season 4, and how burst damage implicitly benefits substantally more from it due to damage patterns. 

The only real difference is that back then, it wasn't clear that riot was intentionally creeping damage, mobility, and increasing the kit budget, all to change the pacing of the game. A game which, has a foundational design that, isn't designed to be played with the current pacing.

As a 24yo, who started playing back at the end of 2009, and having come from the boom of RTS games around that time. This is exactly what riot managed to do, and market that they managed to capture, and are now neglecting.

But the good news is that market holes rarely last, it's just a question of when the next game comes along that targets this audience that riot has abandoned. Well and when the players are willing to give up on their 8+ years of sunk cost into this game.

Thanks for the replies guys. To be honest, I'll be editing out that portion of my post because it has distracted from the rest of my viewpoint. That last bit was really me just saying "Hey, I'm trying to rely on the strategy aspect of the game or macro, but because of damage being so high and often me losing that early advantage due to mechanics, I don't get the opportunity to make shot calls and good macro since the game is over before that part of the game even begins"

My mechanics honestly are not failing b/c of age. More so because of what age brings... more responsibility = less time to play games and hone my skill. I'm sure if I played 40 hours+ of league a week again, I'd have similar mechanics if not better.

I get what you're saying now, that makes sense. I have less time to play now as well due to being older and more responsibilities accumulating, somehow, it's made me slightly better as it's pushed me to value the limited time I have, it's weird. Even worse now because you practically get punished, indirectly, for taking breaks from League since Riot no longer seems to have a clear picture of where they want to take the game. Soooo much stuff changes in a desperate attempt for them to try and find a new meta that appeases to esports.

Basically this. Damage is insane and resistance is useless. If you want to tank hp-stacking ends up being the only real option, and there's a limit to its usage.

I've noticed the trend of increasing the work-arounds and direct nerfs to defensive play and I'm honestly surprised people call more for damage reductions and not resistance efficacy improvements, since the nerfs to counter-play both large and small-scale are so blatant. 
 Things like shield duration/strength are confusingly inconsistent in philosophy between champion classes and positions, newer support actives/bindings dealing pretty significant damage instead of offering outplay potential (both large and small-scale, think banner splitpushing for example). 

Resistances are either:
- Overwhelming (you didn't snowball, have fun hitting a brick wall from levels behind while you get smushed by a snowball)
- Useless (guess who has a handful of resist-ignore items and rendered your entire game worth of gold worthless, half of the enemy team!).

Anyone noticed people building straight hp-damage items can soak up tower shots (like a dedicated tank usually would) when they're fed? I feel bad just watching it tickle me without having actually done anything to counter what is supposed to be a formidable death-tower -- assuming they live long enough to even force me to take more than a couple of hits, damage creep being what it is...

I grew to love Bruiser Riven for the old-season-fights feel of slow sustained damage dealing/receiving (unlike the boring assassin builds). Now the only way going bruiser works is building like a 'juggernaut', which is a stupid concept, damage and survivability should have been fairly linear opposites balance-wise, I know it never was but that's a good indicator that balance has never had a clear direction. The existence of current PD alone is testament to how clueless Riot is rn. Passive outplay potential is more favourable than the once consciously-utilised active of the old Quicksilver Sash? Why are they discouraging agency in a video game? I have no words.

With the introduction of preseason, starting with a bunch of free early damage makes laning feel super cheesy -- but a massive disadvantage myself if I choose to opt out of my abusive runes, as burst champions absolutely decimate anything with a few poke-stacks of harvest under their belt and snowballing being encouraged by riot in each subsequent patch.
That's not fun, it's bull. Why would anyone play ranked?

Very much a child's game now in terms of ease and strategic reliance, but I guess that's fine for their bottom line, so it's fine for us. Right?

Not right.
